meanings.definition: Whiteys (noun): a slang term for white or light-colored underwear
meanings.sent1: I need to buy new whiteys for the summer.
meanings.sent2: She washed her whiteys with bleach to keep them bright.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally wore his whiteys to the beach, thinking they were shorts.
meanings.sent4: The laundry room was filled with a sea of whiteys, hanging to dry.
meanings.sent5: The store had a sale on whiteys, so I stocked up on a few pairs.

meanings.definition: Whiteys (verb): to become pale or turn white in color
meanings.sent1: After being out in the sun all day, his skin started to whiteys.
meanings.sent2: The paint on the walls began to whiteys due to exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden whiteys quickly when winter arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her face whiteys with fear as she heard a loud noise in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph had started to whiteys around the edges from age.

meanings.definition: Whiteys (adjective): having a light or pale color
meanings.sent1: The room was decorated in whiteys tones to create a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: She picked out a whiteys dress for the summer wedding.
meanings.sent3: The whiteys clouds floated lazily across the sky on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The whiteys sand sparkled under the bright sun at the beach.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a whiteys palette to paint a serene landscape.
